title: Postodoctoral scholar in edge systems
description:
**The team working on this project, consisting of the PI with three new PhD students, works across the entire edge stack, (re-)defining how edge systems are designed, built, and operated. Together, we aim to answer the following four research Questions:**



* What is the right architecture to build a distributed edge cloud, taking into account the trade-offs between  

cost, performance, bandwidth, and energy?


* How to design adaptive edge applications that can utilize the full potential of the edge infrastructure given  

the multiple edge constraints?


* How to manage the workload dynamics of real-time edge cloud applications taking into account mobility,  

load spikes, failures, and performance inversion?


* How to manage and process massive data of edge applications in real-time while maintaining the  

requirements on data privacy and security?



**Information about the project and the department**  

This project is funded with a Future Research Leaders SSF grant. You will work closely with the PI and your colleagues on some of the hardest (and most fun!) problems today in computer systems. The division of Computer and Network Systems where you will be employed has top-notch faculty and students covering all fields of computer systems. The department of Computer science and engineering is one of the best computer science departments in Sweden and Europe.


**Main responsibilities**

  


* Research


* Writing research grants


* Maintaining a cutting edge research infrastructure with small and large server nodes



*Your major responsibility as postdoc is to perform your own research in a research group. The position may also include teaching on undergraduate and master's levels as well as supervising master's and/or PhD students to a certain extent. Another important aspect involves collaboration within academia and with society at large. The position is meritorious for future research duties within academia as well as industry/the public sector.*


**Qualifications**  

*To qualify for the position of postdoc, you must hold a doctoral degree awarded no more than three years prior to the application deadline.*


*The position requires sound verbal and written communication skills in English. Swedish is not a requirement but Chalmers offers Swedish courses.*


*You are expected to be somewhat accustomed to teaching, and to demonstrate good potential within research and education.*


* *The date shown in your doctoral degree certificate is the date we use, as this is the date you have met all requirements for the doctoral degree. Exceptions from the 3-year limit can be made for longer periods resulting from parental leave, sick leave or military service.*

  

**Contract terms**  

This postdoc position is a full-time temporary employment for up to three years.  

  

**What we offer**  

Chalmers provides a cultivating and inspiring working environment in the coastal city of Gothenburg.  

Read more about working at Chalmers and our benefits for employees.  

  

Chalmers aims to actively improve our gender balance. We work broadly with equality projects, for example the GENIE Initiative on gender equality for excellence. Equality and diversity are substantial foundations in all activities at Chalmers.  

  

**Application procedure**  

*The application should be written in English* *and be attached as PDF-files, as below. Maximum size for each file is 40 MB. Please note that the system does not support Zip files.*  

  

**CV:** *(Please name the document as: CV, Surname)* including:  

* CV, include complete list of publications
* Previous teaching and pedagogical experiences
* Two references that we can contact.

  

**Personal letter:** *(Please name the document as: Personal letter, Family name)*  

1-3 pages where you:  

* Introduce yourself
* Describe your previous research fields and main research results
* Describe your future goals and future research focus

  

**Other documents:**  

* Attested copies of completed education, grades and other certificates.

  

Use the button at the foot of the page to reach the application form.
**Please note:** The applicant is responsible for ensuring that the application is complete. Incomplete applications and applications sent by email will not be considered.

  

**Application deadline: June 5th, 2025**  

  

**For questions, please contact:**  

Ahmed Hassan, Associate Professor,  

Ahmed.hassan@chalmers.se

  

*\*\*\* Chalmers declines to consider all offers of further announcement publishing or other types of support for the recruiting process in connection with this position.* \*\*\*

  


*Chalmers University of Technology in Gothenburg conducts research and education in technology and natural sciences at a high international level. The university has 3100 employees and 10,000 students, and offers education in engineering, science, shipping and architecture.* *With scientific excellence as a basis, Chalmers promotes knowledge and technical solutions for a sustainable world. Through global commitment and entrepreneurship, we foster an innovative spirit, in close collaboration with wider society.*  

*Chalmers was founded in 1829 and has the same motto today as it did then: Avancez – forward.*

title: Specialist Technical Account Manager - Cloud Operations, AWS North, EMEA EU North, EMEA EU North
description:
DESCRIPTION


Are you a Technologist with deep expertise in Cloud Operations? We're looking for Cloud Operations experts to help our customers achieve operational excellence at scale with their AWS cloud environments. As a Specialist Technical Account Manager (STAM), you act as a Cloud Operations Architect for your designated technology domain. You'll provide strategic guidance to customers on implementing robust operational practices, cloud financial management capabilities, and observability solutions, applying your knowledge of best practices to enhance architectural health, optimize cloud resources, and allow customers to get the most out of their AWS implementation.  

You'll help customers navigate complex operational challenges through the AWS Observability Ambassador Program principles, design resilient cloud architectures that meet performance standards, and implement effective monitoring and optimization controls. You'll guide customers through the lens of Cloud Financial Management (CFM) framework, helping them combine tools, processes, and practices to plan, manage, and optimize cloud costs while enabling innovation and scaling to meet business objectives within budget.  

This is a post-sales advisory role within our Enterprise Support team, where you can further develop your technical, leadership, and consulting skills while working with organizations facing sophisticated cloud operations challenges. You'll leverage Cloud Optimization best practices, guidance, and solutions, including AWS Well-Architected Framework, AWS Trusted Advisor, AWS Health and Operations Reviews to help customers maximize the value they derive from AWS.  

The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success, especially when navigating the evolving landscape of cloud operations. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services while maintaining efficient and optimized cloud environments.  

AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector and other regulated industries. Join us in helping customers build operationally excellent cloud environments that enable innovation while optimizing performance and cost.  

This role is open in Stockholm and Amsterdam  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Provide customers with deep technical expertise in your domain to achieve operational excellence.
* Collaborate with Generalist Technical Account Managers, Solutions Architects, Account Managers and Customer Solutions Manager to ideate around your customers’ most challenging business problems.
* Act as a trusted advisor to line of business and C-suite leaders.
* Lead architectural reviews and workshops to advance your customer’s technical objectives.
* Act as a thought leader sharing best practices through forums such as AWS blogs, whitepapers, reference architectures and public-speaking events such as AWS Summit, AWS re: Invent, etc. Participate as a leader in AWS Technical Field communities.
* Educate and Advice customers on the value proposition of AWS Services and Support products, and participate in architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud.
* Provide data and anecdotes on what is working and what is not back to the larger specialist community and product teams. Act as primary point of contact for urgent customer issues in your technical specialty.

  

A day in the life  

In this role, you'll leverage your extensive technical knowledge to ensure our customers' cloud environments are efficient, optimized, and resilient on the AWS platform. As a trusted advisor, you'll play a pivotal role in ensuring customer success as they implement operational best practices and cloud financial management strategies. This includes providing deep process and technical expertise to help customers overcome complex operational challenges. With your in-depth operations experience and knowledge, you'll guide customers in understanding and implementing best practices for operating in the cloud. This involves assisting customers in mitigating operational risks using scalable and cost-effective solutions on AWS, while applying principles from the AWS Observability Ambassador Program to enhance visibility into their environments. Additionally, you'll develop content and conduct enablement sessions with customers, such as Well-Architected workshops and Cloud Financial Management immersion days, to further enhance their operational capabilities and help them achieve architectural health and cloud optimization across their AWS footprint.  

  

About the team  

Diverse Experiences  

Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.  

Why AWS  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  

Work/Life Balance  

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.  

Inclusive Team Culture  

Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.  

Mentorship and Career Growth  

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 4+ years of design/implementation/operations/consulting of Cloud Operations frameworks
* 4+ years of experience building operational solutions across monitoring, alerting, and automation systems or experience with observability tools and practices such as CloudWatch, Prometheus, and distributed tracing
* Experience in internal enterprise or external customer-facing environment as a technical operations lead
* Experience in Cloud operations such as Cloud Financial Management, architectural optimization, and large-scale operational transformations.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Deep experience in Cloud Operations architecture design, build, deploy and maintenance
* Deep experience implementing and managing Cloud Financial Management practices
* Expertise in AWS observability solutions and the AWS Observability Ambassador Program principles
* Experience conducting Well-Architected Reviews and implementing recommendations
* Proficiency with AWS Trusted Advisor and AWS Health or Operations Reviews
* Demonstrated ability to optimize cloud environments for performance, reliability, and cost
* AWS Certifications, e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate / Professional / Speciality highly desirable.
* Internal enterprise experience working with a wide range of internal stakeholders on operations implementation or migration with a company-wide impact.
* Ability to understand complex application data flows and bridge the gap between technical and business app requirements.
* Strong written communication skills as well as a proven track record of writing clear process and technical documentation

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Kommunikatör med fokus på grafisk formgivning
description:
Om arbetsplatsen


Vår kommunikatör med fokus på grafisk formgivning och innehållsproduktion kommer gå på föräldraledighet och vi söker därför en kreativ och driven kommunikatör för att fylla dennes stol under ledigheten.  

  

Mariestad är i en fantastisk utvecklingsresa!  

Stora etableringar, ett expanderande näringsliv och en kommunorganisation som ställer om för att möta framtiden, det är vad du kommer arbeta med som kommunikatör i Mariestads kommun.


Arbetsuppgifter


Som kommunikatör på Mariestads kommun ingår du i ett arbetslag bestående av fyra personer som tillsammans med kommunikationschef arbetar brett för kommunens verksamheter.  

  

Här arbetar du med att öka kommunens synlighet och attraktivitet genom att skapa engagerande marknadsföringsmaterial samt driva kommunikationsprojekt. Du kommer att vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som ansvarar för att driva och utveckla det externa och interna kommunikationsarbetet. I uppdraget ingår även operativt och strategiskt stöd gentemot kommunens verksamheter.  

  

I den här rollen ser vi att du har särskild fokus på grafisk formgivning och innehållsproduktion till olika kanaler. Du kommer även agera som projektledare för kommunikationsprojekt och tillsammans med dina kollegor hantera kommunens sociala medier och digitala plattformar.


Kvalifikationer


Vi söker dig som har en akademisk utbildning inom kommunikation eller annan utbildning/erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant.  

  

Du har erfarenhet av kommunikationsarbete med inriktning mot grafisk formgivning och innehållsproduktion. Vi ser även att du har kunskaper i Adobe Creative Cloud (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, Premier Pro).  

  

Har du erfarenhet från arbete inom offentlig verksamhet är det meriterande.  

  

Som kommunikatör har du en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i olika ämnen, förstå och förklara komplexa sammanhang samt hantera kommunikativa utmaningar. Du är skicklig på att utföra de olika arbetsuppgifter som förekommer inom en kommunikationsenhet, såsom grafisk formgivning, produktion av trycksaker, textbearbetning och publicering i digitala kanaler. Dessutom har du en mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig både muntligt och skriftligt.  

  

Vi söker dig som är kreativ, självgående och har en stark känsla för detaljer. Du är en lagspelare som trivs med att arbeta i ett team och har förmågan att hantera flera projekt samtidigt.  

  

Du är ansvarstagande och kan driva arbetet framåt, både självständigt och i grupp. I denna roll kommer du att ha många kontaktytor därför är det viktigt att du är serviceinriktad, har lätt för att bygga relationer och skapa förtroende hos de du möter. Du är lyhörd, ser möjligheter och tvekar inte att föreslå förbättringar.  

  

När du gör din ansökan vill vi ha ett cv där dina tidigare meriter framgår. Det personliga brevet kan du däremot utesluta, istället får du besvara några urvalsfrågor. Rekryteringen sker löpande och intervjuer kan ske redan under ansökningsperioden.  

  

Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och goda referenser.  

  

Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Initiativledare och kravanalytiker
description:
Uppdrag – Initiativledare och kravanalytiker för utveckling av statistik- och analysplattform
  
Ett större datadrivet initiativ pågår under 2025 där en statistik- och analysplattform ska vidareutvecklas för att i högre grad möta såväl interna som externa behov. Plattformen har hittills fokuserat på att leverera statistik till externa parter via ett befintligt datawarehouse, men kommer nu att moderniseras med ny målinriktad arkitektur baserad på datavault-modellering och stegvis migreras mot molnlösningar.
  
Nu söks en konsult som kan kombinera rollerna som initiativledare och kravanalytiker och som kan leda det pågående arbetet framåt, med särskilt fokus på användarnytta, teknisk transformation och verksamhetsdialog.
  
Arbetsuppgifter – Initiativledning
  
Leda och driva det strategiska utvecklingsarbetet av analysportalen
  
Koordinera aktiviteter och engagera intressenter från olika verksamhetsområden
  
Leda workshops och arbetsmöten för att säkerställa samsyn och framdrift
  
Delta i utformningen av målbilden för plattformens nya arkitektur
  
Hantera kommunikation, rapportering, beroenden och risker inom ramen för projektet
  
Ge regelbundna statusuppdateringar till styrgrupp och ledning
  
  

Arbetsuppgifter – Kravanalys
  
Samla in, dokumentera och strukturera krav och behov från verksamheten
  
Planera och genomföra intervjuer och workshops för att fånga in detaljerad information
  
Kartlägga systemlandskapet och analysera integrationer och datakällor
  
Prioritera krav i samverkan med projektets nyckelpersoner
  
Säkerställa spårbar och tydlig dokumentation av krav och användningsfall
  
  

Kravprofil – måste uppfyllas
  
Civilingenjörsexamen från teknisk högskola
  
9–12 års erfarenhet i IT-relaterade roller, varav minst 5 år som uppdragsledare för projekt kopplade till rapportering, analys eller beslutsstöd
  
Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda utvecklingsteam och samordna med både tekniska och affärsmässiga aktörer
  
Minst 5 års erfarenhet av kravanalys i komplexa IT-miljöer
  
Certifiering inom Informatica IDMC (Intelligent Data Management Cloud)
  
Genomfört hela utvecklingskedjan för analysplattform – från val av verktyg till modellering, gränssnittsutveckling och onboarding
  
Aktuell erfarenhet av att migrera datalösningar från lokal miljö till molnbaserad lösning
  
Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga i svenska, både muntligt och skriftligt
  
  

Meriterande erfarenheter
  
Djup kunskap om datamodellering inom Data Vault och dimensionsmodellering
  
Bred teknisk erfarenhet från flera data- och analysplattformar, både lokalt installerade och molnbaserade (t.ex. Informatica, Power BI, Qlik Sense, Cloudera)
  
Ledd utveckling av arkitekturstrategier för datadrivet beslutsstöd
  
Självständigt arbetat med metodval, insamling och analys av krav från verksamheten via intervjuer och workshops
  
Erfarenhet av styrning och analys utifrån ett datadrivet perspektiv
  
  

Övrigt
  
**Arbetsort:** Stockholm
  
Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 49 % enligt överenskommelse
  
**Uppdragsperiod:** 5 juni 2025 – 4 juni 2026, med option på förlängning i ytterligare ett år
  
**Omfattning:** 100 %
  
  

Om Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Project Administrator (Swedish and English required)
description:
**Role:** Project Administrator (Program Coordinator & Facilitator)
  
**Seniority Level:** Senior
  
**Location:** Stockholm, Sweden

Assignment Description
  
Our client is seeking a Program Coordinator & Facilitator for the strategic initiative “New Channels,” aimed at modernizing and future-proofing their digital customer experience. The program includes building a new frontend architecture, migrating digital services and apps, and establishing a cloud-based development platform.
  
Program Goals

About the Role
  
You will work closely with the Program Manager, playing a key role in structuring activities, coordinating work, and facilitating collaboration within and around the program. This role is ideal for individuals experienced in complex initiatives who bring clarity, responsiveness, and a results-driven mindset.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
Coordination and Structure

Qualifications

Coordination
  
Documentation

title: Program Manager (English & Swedish Proficient)
description:
**Role:** Program Manager
  
**Seniority Level:** Senior
  
**Location:** Stockholm, Sweden
  
**Remote Work:** Up to 25%
  
**Application Deadline:** May 27, 2025
  
Assignment Description
  
We are seeking a Program Manager for our client.
  
General Role Description
  
A Program Manager within the client organization has a strategic role responsible for the long-term outcomes of multiple streams and how they impact each other. The Program Manager is in charge of coordinating multiple projects and streams across all their phases until delivery. The Program Manager reports to a steering committee and is responsible for ensuring the program’s goals regarding delivery time, quality, and cost are met.
  
Background of the Assignment
  
The client is establishing the "New Channels" program – a strategic initiative aimed at modernizing and future-proofing their digital customer experience. The program focuses on building a new frontend architecture, migrating existing digital services and apps, and establishing a cloud-based developer platform.
  
The goal is to create conditions for personalized customer journeys, smooth and cohesive customer experiences across channels, high development efficiency in web and app development, and rapid cycles with high automation, resulting in shorter lead times from idea to customer value.
  
The program is now transitioning from a preparatory phase to an established program with long-term governance, coordination, and delivery focus.
  
About the Role
  
We are looking for a senior program manager with experience leading large, tech-focused transformation programs involving many stakeholders and dependencies with other programs and agile delivery streams. You will work closely with business leadership, IT organizations, and external partners. The role requires the ability to create momentum, collaboration, and alignment – both strategically and operationally – while clearly communicating technical solutions in an engaging way.
  
You will work in a complex organization with many stakeholders, so being structured, pragmatic, and possessing strong communication skills are essential. Your ability to collaborate, build trust, and, at the same time, be decisive in driving progress is central. Experience with the client’s culture and federated structure is a significant advantage. You must also understand the importance of a strong customer experience and integrate customer needs into technical solutions.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
Planning and Execution
  
Lead the development of the program structure and organization, clarifying roles and responsibilities.
  
Develop and drive an overall program plan, including timelines, phases, budget, and goals in an agile delivery format.
  
  

Resource Coordination
  
Coordinate resources, competencies, technology, and external parties to ensure proper staffing and delivery capacity over time.
  
  

Risk Management
  
Identify and analyze risks related to technology, delivery, organization, and dependencies.
  
  

Communication
  
Clearly communicate what needs to be done, by whom, and why.
  
Establish and execute communication plans that foster involvement and alignment.
  
  

Stakeholder Management
  
Work cross-functionally to build collaboration between business, technology, and other programs (e.g., CRM, AI).
  
Engage with decision-makers and various forums and stakeholder groups to ensure alignment.
  
  

Goal Management and Follow-up
  
Monitor key deliverables, ensure alignment with goals, and proactively address deviations.
  
  

Coaching and Leadership
  
Support teams and stakeholders in problem-solving and progress with an influential and advisory role.
  
Be prepared to propose and make difficult decisions.
  
  

Qualifications
  
Extensive experience leading large, tech-focused transformation programs in complex organizations.
  
Strong experience with agile methods and delivering value through frequent releases, learning, and working within parallel program and line structures.
  
Ability to plan, coordinate, and drive parallel streams of work with numerous dependencies.
  
Experience with programs and operations involving cloud-based development, microservices, DevSecOps, and hybrid app strategies.
  
Skilled in communicating technology in a business-friendly and educational manner, both to leadership and development teams.
  
Ability to understand and connect complex relationships between teams, products, architecture, business, and operations through effective collaboration with stream leaders, stakeholders, and expertise.
  
Experience collaborating in matrix organizations and federated structures.
  
Experience with customer experience and digital channels.
  
**Desirable:** Previous experience with the client or in a similar environment.
  
  

Personal Attributes
  
Strong communication skills – you explain clearly, build trust, and foster understanding.
  
Structured – you clarify what needs to be delivered and by whom.
  
Well-developed strategic thinking and effective execution capability to build trust and engagement.
  
Collaborative – comfortable working in complex collaboration with multiple actors.
  
Pragmatic – you find ways forward without losing direction.
  
Experience with LF (Leadership Framework) is a plus, but the most important attribute is the ability to understand and navigate a complex business environment.
  
  

Experience Requirements
  
**Knowledge:** High generalist competence or very high competence in the relevant area.
  
**Experience:** At least 9-12 years of experience as a consultant in the relevant field, having completed large assignments with exceptional quality. This level is typically reached after 9-12 years in consulting and at least 2 years at senior level (Level 3).
  
**Leadership:** Responsible for leading a large group or program.
  
**Independence:** Highly independent.

title: Red Team/Hacker
description:
Jobbify är en jobbplattform för erfarna kandidater.
  
  

För kunds räkning har vi publicerat denna annons, vill du komma i kontakt med den slutgiltiga arbetsgivaren kan du klicka dig vidare till annonsen:
  
  

Om Cparta
  
  

Cparta Cyber Defense är ett snabbt växande kommersiellt företag inom cyberförsvar med ett tydligt syfte – att bidra till ett tryggare och säkrare samhälle. Vi skyddar inte bara våra kunders digitala tillgångar, utan är också en aktiv del i att stärka Sveriges cyberresiliens i en tid där hotbilden ständigt förändras.
  
Genom att kombinera spetskompetens med ett djupt samhällsengagemang är vi med och försvarar demokratin, näringslivet och människors integritet. Vår kultur präglas av mod, innovation, ödmjukhet och stark teamkänsla.
  
  

**Vi söker fler som delar vår övertygelse:** att verklig förändring skapas tillsammans – och att vi hand i hand kan göra Sverige säkrare.
  
  

Om rollen
  
  

Som Red Team/Hacker i vårt Red Team jobbar du för att stärka intern och extern säkerhet genom att hacka nätverk, applikationer och testa fysisk säkerhet för att avslöja sårbarheter, höja säkerheten och utbilda anställda.
  
  

Du kommer att utföra säkerhetsgranskningar av system och applikationer med hjälp av penetrationstester, etiska hackingverktyg och metoder för att utvärdera sårbarheter internt och hos våra kunder. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att utveckla egen förmåga, hitta nya exploits och emulera avancerade aktörer. I din roll kommer du primärt jobba med Red Team-övningar men det förekommer också flertalet säkerhetstester, både web applikationer, mobil applikationer och infrastruktur tester.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som har:**  

Mångårig erfarenhet från liknande tjänst, gärna som konsult.
  
  

Gedigen kunskap inom både defensiva och offensiva verktyg.
  
  

Detaljerad teknisk förståelse av områden som nätverk, cloud, AD och operativsystem, både Windows, Linux och Mac.
  
  

Stark kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga.
  
  

Stark analytisk och problemlösande förmåga.
  
  

Det är meriterande om du har kunskap av något eller flera av följande områden:
  
  

C2 ramverk
  
  

Mjukvaruutveckling
  
  

EDR bypassing
  
  

Active Directory
  
  

Webbapplikations testning
  
  

Reverse-engineering
  
  

Sårbarhetsanalys
  
  

Exploit-utveckling
  
  

Molntjänster (AWS/Azure/GCP)
  
  

**Någon av följande certifieringar:** OSCP, OSCE, GPEN, GXPEN, GWAP, CRTP, CISSP eller motsvarande.
  
  

Rekryteringsprocess
  
  

Vi tror på att skapa en personlig och transparent process där både du och vi får lära känna varandra på riktigt.
  
  

Första steget är en intervju på vårt centrala kontor på Kungsgatan 37, där du träffar din blivande chef för ett samtal om vem du är och vad vi står för som bolag.
  
  

Därefter får du möta några av dina framtida teamkollegor – ett viktigt tillfälle för att både känna in dynamiken och fördjupa oss i din kompetens.
  
  

Nästa steg är ett förmånssamtal med HR där vi går igenom erbjudandet, villkor och förmåner.
  
  

Referenser
  
  

Om vi alla känner att vi har en match, så följer en säkerhetsintervju på plats. I det skedet genomför vi även bakgrundskontroll.
  
  

Krav
  
  

För att arbeta hos oss måste du vara svensk medborgare, ostraffad och genomgå en bakgrundskontroll.
  
  

Ansökan
  
  

Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta Benjamin Karlsson på Bka@cparta.se. Vi rekryterar löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt och bli en del av vårt växande team.

title: Specialist Technical Account Manager - Cloud Operations, AWS North, EMEA EU North, EMEA EU North
description:
• 4+ years of design/implementation/operations/consulting of Cloud Operations frameworks
• 4+ years of experience building operational solutions across monitoring, alerting, and automation systems or experience with observability tools and practices such as CloudWatch, Prometheus, and distributed tracing
• Experience in internal enterprise or external customer-facing environment as a technical operations lead
• Experience in Cloud operations such as Cloud Financial Management, architectural optimization, and large-scale operational transformations.
  

Are you a Technologist with deep expertise in Cloud Operations? We're looking for Cloud Operations experts to help our customers achieve operational excellence at scale with their AWS cloud environments. As a Specialist Technical Account Manager (STAM), you act as a Cloud Operations Architect for your designated technology domain. You'll provide strategic guidance to customers on implementing robust operational practices, cloud financial management capabilities, and observability solutions, applying your knowledge of best practices to enhance architectural health, optimize cloud resources, and allow customers to get the most out of their AWS implementation.
You'll help customers navigate complex operational challenges through the AWS Observability Ambassador Program principles, design resilient cloud architectures that meet performance standards, and implement effective monitoring and optimization controls. You'll guide customers through the lens of Cloud Financial Management (CFM) framework, helping them combine tools, processes, and practices to plan, manage, and optimize cloud costs while enabling innovation and scaling to meet business objectives within budget.
This is a post-sales advisory role within our Enterprise Support team, where you can further develop your technical, leadership, and consulting skills while working with organizations facing sophisticated cloud operations challenges. You'll leverage Cloud Optimization best practices, guidance, and solutions, including AWS Well-Architected Framework, AWS Trusted Advisor, AWS Health and Operations Reviews to help customers maximize the value they derive from AWS.
The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success, especially when navigating the evolving landscape of cloud operations. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services while maintaining efficient and optimized cloud environments.
AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector and other regulated industries. Join us in helping customers build operationally excellent cloud environments that enable innovation while optimizing performance and cost.
This role is open in Stockholm and Amsterdam
Key job responsibilities
• Provide customers with deep technical expertise in your domain to achieve operational excellence.
• Collaborate with Generalist Technical Account Managers, Solutions Architects, Account Managers and Customer Solutions Manager to ideate around your customers’ most challenging business problems.
• Act as a trusted advisor to line of business and C-suite leaders.
• Lead architectural reviews and workshops to advance your customer’s technical objectives.
• Act as a thought leader sharing best practices through forums such as AWS blogs, whitepapers, reference architectures and public-speaking events such as AWS Summit, AWS re: Invent, etc. Participate as a leader in AWS Technical Field communities.
• Educate and Advice customers on the value proposition of AWS Services and Support products, and participate in architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud.
• Provide data and anecdotes on what is working and what is not back to the larger specialist community and product teams. Act as primary point of contact for urgent customer issues in your technical specialty.
A day in the life
In this role, you'll leverage your extensive technical knowledge to ensure our customers' cloud environments are efficient, optimized, and resilient on the AWS platform. As a trusted advisor, you'll play a pivotal role in ensuring customer success as they implement operational best practices and cloud financial management strategies. This includes providing deep process and technical expertise to help customers overcome complex operational challenges. With your in-depth operations experience and knowledge, you'll guide customers in understanding and implementing best practices for operating in the cloud. This involves assisting customers in mitigating operational risks using scalable and cost-effective solutions on AWS, while applying principles from the AWS Observability Ambassador Program to enhance visibility into their environments. Additionally, you'll develop content and conduct enablement sessions with customers, such as Well-Architected workshops and Cloud Financial Management immersion days, to further enhance their operational capabilities and help them achieve architectural health and cloud optimization across their AWS footprint.
About the team
Diverse Experiences
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship and Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional
  

* Deep experience in Cloud Operations architecture design, build, deploy and maintenance
* Deep experience implementing and managing Cloud Financial Management practices
* Expertise in AWS observability solutions and the AWS Observability Ambassador Program principles
* Experience conducting Well-Architected Reviews and implementing recommendations
* Proficiency with AWS Trusted Advisor and AWS Health or Operations Reviews
* Demonstrated ability to optimize cloud environments for performance, reliability, and cost
* AWS Certifications, e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate / Professional / Speciality highly desirable.
* Internal enterprise experience working with a wide range of internal stakeholders on operations implementation or migration with a company-wide impact.
* Ability to understand complex application data flows and bridge the gap between technical and business app requirements.
* Strong written communication skills as well as a proven track record of writing clear process and technical documentation

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
company_description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, with over 200 powerful services that enable our customers and our people to make more of an impact.

title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey
description:
Do you want to work on complex and pressing challenges—the kind that bring together curious, ambitious, and determined leaders who strive to become better every day? **If this sounds like you, you’ve come to the right place.**
**Your Impact**
---------------


You will work with other data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers and project managers on interdisciplinary projects, using math, stats and machine learning to derive structure and knowledge from raw data across various industry sectors.
You will be a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly.
As a Data Scientist, you will:* Partner with our clients, from data owners and users to C-level executives, to understand their needs and build impactful analytics solutions.
* Contribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and client.
* Translate business problems into analytical problems and develop models aimed at solving our clients and users problems and ensure they are evaluated with the relevant metrics.
* Write highly optimized code to advance our internal Data Science Toolbox.
* You will do Machine Learning & statistical modelling as well as implementing generative AI and LLM use cases.
* Add real-world impact to your academic expertise, as you are encouraged to write papers and present at meetings and conferences should you wish.
* You will take part in R&D projects; attend conferences such as NIPS and ICML as well as data science retrospectives where you will have the opportunity to share and learn from your co-workers; work in one of the most advanced data science teams globally.
* Work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of data scientists and data engineers use to progress from data to impact; you will guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport.

**Your Growth**
---------------


**Only at McKinsey****Work on real-world, high-impact projects across a variety of industries**– Identify micro patterns in data that our clients can exploit to maintain their competitive advantage and watch your technical solutions transform their day-to-day business.**Experience the best environment to grow as a technologist and a leader**– Develop a sought-after perspective connecting technology and business value by working on real-life problems across a variety of industries and technical challenges to serve our clients on their changing needs.**Be surrounded by inspiring individuals as part of diverse multidisciplinary teams** - Develop a holistic perspective of AI by partnering with the best design, technical, and business talent in the world as your team members.**Our Tech Stack**
While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.
**Your qualifications and skills**
----------------------------------


* Bachelor's, master's or PhD level in a discipline such as: computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, engineering or artificial intelligence
* 0-2 years of professional experience in applying machine learning and data mining techniques to real problems with copious amounts of data
* Programming experience (focus on machine learning): R and/or Python (must). Experience with PySpark/PyData is desirable
* Ability to prototype statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data driven solutions to problems in new domains
* Ability to independently own and drive model development, balancing demands and deadlines
* Demonstrated aptitude for analytics
* Good presentation and communication skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields
* Willingness to travel
company_description: McKinsey & Company is a privately owned management consulting firm committed to accelerating sustainable and inclusive growth.

title: Molnspecialist
description:
**Uppdrag – Molntekniker med inriktning på säkerhet och infrastruktur**


Vi söker en erfaren molntekniker med djup kunskap inom IT-säkerhet och moderna molnlösningar för ett uppdrag där du ansvarar för granskning och förbättring av en digital tjänsts tekniska plattform.


Tjänsten är ett webbaserat bibliotek som tillhandahåller litteratur på flera språk och är tillgänglig för användare i flera nordiska länder. Lösningen är frikopplad från övriga biblioteksplattformar och har en egenutvecklad teknisk infrastruktur som inkluderar användarhantering, innehållsleverans och ett skräddarsytt CMS. Tjänstens backend körs huvudsakligen i en molnmiljö baserad på Google Cloud Platform.

**Om uppdraget**


En tidigare översiktlig analys har identifierat ett antal säkerhetsbrister kopplade till bland annat nätverkssegmentering, användarhantering och versioner av centrala komponenter. Din roll blir att genomföra en fördjupad granskning av molninfrastrukturen, dokumentera identifierade brister, bedöma risknivåer och därefter genomföra rekommenderade åtgärder. Du kommer att arbeta nära systemförvaltningen och löpande återrapportera resultat och framsteg.

**Förväntade leveranser:**

* En heltäckande säkerhets- och konfigurationsanalys av systemets backendmiljö
* En åtgärdsplan med prioriterade förbättringspunkter
* Säkerställd användarhantering enligt vedertagna säkerhetsprinciper
* Uppgradering av molnresurser till långsiktigt stödda versioner (t.ex. CloudSQL och Kubernetes)
* Genomgång och justering av nätverksinställningar och brandväggar för att uppnå en rimlig säkerhetsnivå per subnät

**Obligatoriska kvalifikationer:**

* Minst fem års erfarenhet av konfiguration och administration i Google Cloud Platform
* Djup teknisk kunskap inom Node.js, GraphQL, Hasura, Kubernetes och CloudSQL
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta med säkerhetslösningar för IT-infrastruktur
* Vana vid avancerad säkerhetskonfiguration i molnmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av arbete med Firebase
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift

**Omfattning och tidsramar**


Uppdraget är planerat att starta omgående och pågå till mitten av juni, med möjlighet till förlängning. Uppskattad arbetsinsats omfattar en inledande introduktion, analysfas samt genomförande av åtgärder under cirka två arbetsveckor. Viss flexibilitet finns för arbete på distans, men närvaro på plats kan förekomma.

**Ansökan**


För att bli aktuell för uppdraget ska du inkomma med följande:

* Uppdaterat CV på svenska
* Genomförandeplan med förslag på arbetsmetod
* Tillgänglighet för uppdragets start
* En kort motivering till varför du är rätt person för uppdraget, med referenser till tidigare erfarenheter, uppdrag eller utbildningar

 **Om Rasulson Consulting**  

Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Specialist SE
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*

Job Category


Sales
Job Details


**About Salesforce**

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.


**Salesforce** , the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World’s Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For seven years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win.


**Join us!**

**About the Position**  

The Salesforce Marketing Cloud Solutions Engineering team is a diverse group of technology and business process experts that support direct sales to prospects, customers, and partners by creating, packaging, and demonstrating innovative solutions tailored to client needs.  



  

Salesforce Marketing Cloud is a market leader in digital marketing, encompassing Data, Advertising, Inbound Marketing (web, mobile), and Outbound marketing (email, SMS, mobile, web, Ads, human touch channels) and their orchestration.


The role of the Solution Engineer is to collaborate with the Account Executive in discovery, assess solution fit and commercial opportunity, build a solution and architecture vision, and provide proof through presentations, demos, RFP responses, proof of concepts, and business cases. This includes presenting to various levels within the customer organization, from specialist roles and digital and marketing managers to Director and C-Level executives in General Management, Marketing, and IT.


**Requirements**  

- Proven track record of success with several years of experience in a similar role.
  

- Experience in B2C industries such as Retail, CPG, Financial Services, Travel & Transport, etc.
  

- Excellent presentation skills, comfortable presenting to diverse audiences, from a crowd of a thousand to a CMO or two developers.
  

- Familiarity with running discovery workshops, proof of concepts, and applying design thinking techniques.
  

- Ability to switch quickly between different modes of thinking and tasks.
  

- Self-starter who is highly creative and able to manage and prioritize effectively.
  

- Ability to work with the sales team to understand and present a business case to clients, articulating a technical solution and highlighting business benefits in a language they understand.
  

- Deep technical expertise in any of the following domains: digital marketing, customer data platforms, advertising, commerce, BI & Analytics, Web analytics, CRM, CMS.
  

- Knowledge of modern marketing and web technologies.
  

- Strong conceptual understanding of database design and proficiency in database queries.
  

- BA/BS preferred or equivalent work experience with demonstrated proficiency.
  

- Fluent in English + Swedish + Right to Work in Sweden


**It would be great if…**  

- You have prior digital marketing experience.
  

- You have worked for a SaaS computing company.
  

- You have presented and sold to marketers before.


Accommodations


If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .


Posting Statement


Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: AI Product Architect
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------

  

About this opportunity

  

Job Location: Santa Clara-CA, Plano-TX or Stockholm-Sweden

*Ericsson Inc. does not sponsor US work authorizations for this job position including H-1B, O-1, and TN. Ericsson also does not hire F-1’s working on EAD for this position.*

  

We seek a visionary architect to lead the end-to-end design of our Agentic AI Platform. You will establish the core architecture that integrates LLMs, AI gateways, data layers, and observability frameworks, ensuring scalability, security, and continuous innovation. If you’re passionate about bringing Generative AI and Agentic AI from concept to production, we want you on our team.

**What you will do**
--------------------


* Architecture Ownership: Design and maintain the platform’s blueprint for LLMs, AI gateways, Agentic framework, and data/observability layers.
* Agentic AI Integration: Implement multi-agent orchestration, ensuring secure, autonomous operations.
* Model Context Protocol (MCP): Guide consistent data ingestion, prompt generation, and response handling.
* Scalability & Security: Manage large-scale data pipelines, robust model serving, and compliance adherence.
* Observability & Governance: Integrate platform monitoring, cost management, and AI governance best practices.
* Team Leadership: Mentor engineers and collaborate with stakeholders on roadmap and prioritization.
**The skills you bring**
------------------------


* 10+ years in large-scale architecture, with 3+ in AI/ML/NLP.
* Proficiency in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), MLOps, and GenAIoPS.
* Hands-on experience with LLM platforms (Azure OpenAI, Google Vertex, AWS Bedrock).
* Strong understanding of Agentic AI principles and multi-agent orchestration.
* Leadership skills to influence cross-functional teams and implement ethical AI frameworks.
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

 **What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

Ericsson uses a merit-based hiring approach that values people with different experiences, perspectives and skillsets. We truly believe this approach drives innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action (Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities) employer, learn more.

  

If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.mana@ericsson.com

  

DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees in this position. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for this position, and you may be required to perform additional job tasks as assigned.

 **Primary country and city:** United States (US) || Santa Clara

**Job details:** IT Product Architect

 **Compensation and Benefits at Ericsson**


At Ericsson, we know that our people are the key to our success. We offer a competitive package to help with your individual needs and goals.

 **Your Pay**


The salary offered is dependent on various factors including, but not limited to, location, the candidate’s combination of job-related knowledge, qualifications, skills, education, training, and experience.

* Santa Clara : $166,800- $250,200

 **Short-Term Variable Compensation Plan**: Your pay also includes the opportunity for an annual bonus. Actual bonus payouts are based on performance of the business against the unit’s objectives, individual performance, and the individual bonus target. Certain eligibility and pro-ration rules apply.

 **Your Health**


Ericsson offers excellent health benefits including the choice of three medical plan options and a dental plan option that allow an employee to select the level of coverage that suits their needs. Employees will receive company credits in an amount equal to the cost that Ericsson pays toward the cost of their medical and dental premiums for themselves and eligible covered dependents.

 **Your Financial Security**


We invest in both your short and long-term financial wellbeing. The Ericsson US 401(k) Plan offers an automatic 3% company contribution and Ericsson matches $1 for every $1 you put into the 401(k) Plan on the first 3% of your eligible pay, plus 50 cents on every $1 on the next 2% of eligible pay. When you contribute at least 5% of eligible pay, you are receiving Ericsson’s full matching contributions. Matching and company automatic contributions stop when your total eligible pay for the year reaches the IRS limits. Employees will also receive company credits in an amount equal to the cost of basic life insurance and basic accidental death and dismemberment coverage, as well as short-term and long-term disability coverage. Employees also have the option to participate in Ericsson’s Stock Purchase Plan.

 **Your Time**


Your work-life balance is important to us. New employees are provided a minimum of 15 days of accrued vacation, up to 3 personal days per year, 11 annual holidays, 8 hours of volunteer time, and 80 hours of sick time annually. Please note paid time off is pro-rated based on the employee’s start date. Furthermore, Ericsson provides up to 16 weeks of paid maternity leave and 6 weeks of parental or adoption leave at 100% of pay.

 **Additional Benefits**


Ericsson offers many other company-paid benefits such as financial wellness programs, educational assistance, matching gifts, and recognition programs.

title: Marketing & Content Interns
description:
**Company Description**
  

 Devoteam G Cloud is an award-winning Google Cloud partner known for its innovative and collaborative culture. With a team of over 600 Google Cloud experts, we deliver cutting-edge solutions to businesses across the globe. Our Stockholm office is a hub for creativity and technological advancement.
   

  

  

**Job Description**
  

 We're looking for talented interns to join our team in
 **Stockholm** 
 this spring (
 **February - May 2025** 
 ). Are you passionate about content, SEO, and design? Or do you thrive in the fast-paced world of marketing and events? We have exciting opportunities in two key areas:

 Boost your skills in content creation, SEO, design, and event planning. Contribute to blog posts, social media content, website updates, and more.

 Dive into social media management, email campaigns, market analysis, and event coordination. Help us reach new audiences and promote our services.


  

  

**Qualifications**
* Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in marketing, communications, business, or a related field.

**Additional Information**
  

**What You Gain:**

 Apply your skills to real-world projects and make a tangible impact.

 Learn from experienced professionals and Google Cloud experts.
* **Networking opportunities:** 
 Build connections with leaders in the tech industry.

 Gain insight into the world of cloud computing and the latest Google Cloud technologies.
